page.title: 02HOUSING, CANON PYON DISTRICT
page.content: The houses range from 14_18th century {timber-framed}to modern{brick}.There are some stone houses, especially at Westhope.A copy of a timber-framed house has recently been built.Many of the{timber-famed, wattle and daub {panelled cottages}were originally four-roomed agricultural dwellings.In the 1830's there seems to have been a spate of modernisations, with brick replacing some of the timber-framing. In the last 20 years many cottages have been modernised and extended. Westhope has been{repopulated}because many of the{derelict cottages}have been made into very acceptable homes. Westhope houses, typical of unplanned {Common Land}development, were probably erected in one day.Some cottage deeds give owners{grazing-rights}on the Common.Present{planning policy}seems to allow only agricultural dwellings.
